Sentencas: The reduction and operation of Ni-YSZ anode-supported tubular cells on methane fuel is described.
Titulo: Characterisation of electrical performance of anode supported micro-tubular solid oxide fuel cell with methane fuel

Sentencas: Cells were reduced on pure methane from 650 degrees C to 850 degrees C, varying reduction time and methane flow rate.
Titulo: Characterisation of electrical performance of anode supported micro-tubular solid oxide fuel cell with methane fuel

Sentencas: The effect on electrochemical performance with methane fuel was then investigated at 850 degrees C after which temperature-programmed oxidation (TPO) was employed to measure carbon deposition.
Titulo: Characterisation of electrical performance of anode supported micro-tubular solid oxide fuel cell with methane fuel

Sentencas: Results showed that carbon deposition was minimized after certain reduction conditions.
Titulo: Characterisation of electrical performance of anode supported micro-tubular solid oxide fuel cell with methane fuel

Sentencas: The conclusion was that 30 min reduction at 650 degrees C with 10 ml min(-1) methane reduction flow rate led to the highest current output over 1.2 A cm(-2) at 0.5 V when the cell operated at 850 degrees C between 10 ml min(-1) and 12.5 ml min(-1) methane running flow rate.
Titulo: Characterisation of electrical performance of anode supported micro-tubular solid oxide fuel cell with methane fuel

Sentencas: From these results, it is evident that solid oxide fuel cell (SOFC) performance can be substantially improved by optimising preparation, reduction and operating conditions without the need for hydrogen.
Titulo: Characterisation of electrical performance of anode supported micro-tubular solid oxide fuel cell with methane fuel
Characterisation of electrical performance of anode supported micro-tubular solid oxide fuel cell with methane fuel
